import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

import re

source.eaa8705b:
decade_lis =  df['decade'].unique()
sns.set_style('darkgrid')
fig,axes = plt.subplots(4,2,figsize=(20,20))
axes = axes.flatten()
sns.set_palette('Set2')
for i in range(len(decade_lis)):
    ax = sns.countplot(y='genre',data=df[df['decade']==decade_lis[i]],ax=axes[i],order=df[df['decade']==decade_lis[i]]['genre'].value_counts().index)
    ax.set_title(decade_lis[i])
    fig.show()
plt.show()

source.a18de856:
fig, ax= plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(20,10))
y=[]
y.append(np.sum(df[df['movie_francise'] !='None']['total_gross'])/len(df[df['movie_francise'] !='None']['total_gross']))
y.append(np.sum(df[df['movie_francise'] =='None']['total_gross'])/len(df[df['movie_francise'] =='None']['total_gross']))
x=["movies that have francise","movies that don't have francise"]
fig1 = sns.barplot(x=x,y=y,ax=ax[0])
fig1.set_title('total gross')
y=[]
y.append(np.sum(df[df['movie_francise'] !='None']['inflation_adjusted_gross'])/len(df[df['movie_francise'] !='None']['inflation_adjusted_gross']))
y.append(np.sum(df[df['movie_francise'] =='None']['inflation_adjusted_gross'])/len(df[df['movie_francise'] =='None']['inflation_adjusted_gross']))
x=["movies that have francise","movies that don't have francise"]
fig2 = sns.barplot(x=x,y=y,ax=ax[1])
fig2.set_title('iflation adjusted gross')
plt.show()
source.6f1ee112:
Note:For now, I have only considered the following movie franchises:-
  • Toy Story
  • Pirates of the Caribbean
  • Cars
  • Prince of Persia
  • Muppets
  • Marvel
  • Star Wars
Which is not an exhaustive list of all Disney Franchises in a future version I may include more but for moment being my further analysis is based on these franchises only
source.fa12c7b5:
📌In recent years Disney is making more movies compared to earlier
📌the total gross of recent movies are more compared to old movies but if we see inflated gross then old movies performed better
📌with time Disney seemed to try new movies market and seemed to make movies in almost all genre
📌Disney seemed to focus on making comedy movies for the last few Decades but recently they have started to focus more on the adventure/action genre which works best for them probably due to acquiring large production companies like Lucasfilm and Marvel Studios
source.5cbbc2db:
# Introduction 

This notebook is for EDA and Data storytelling on the Disney Movie Gross Income Dataset. We will see all the trends of Disney Movies and how their genre, rating affect their performance
source.9cf66876: using release_date let's make another variable decade which shows how trends of Disney movies changed over decades
source.e02f1b3f:
[](http://)
Let's see if movies which have a franchise performed better to movies who don't have franchise
source.4bf638c2: Let's use the Decade variable for further trend analysis
source.18913b2a: The dataset contains some null values in genre and mpaa_rating which I am going to fill as 'NaN'

source.64935731: 📌In both cases, it is clear that on average movies that are in a franchise perform much better
source.16bd3539: The dataset only contains movies that were originally produced by Disney so all movies that were later purchased by Disney are excluded for example:- star wars movies made after 2012 are only included
source.0798cd8b: Note: every movie released before 1950 is in one category and the category 2010-2020 only contain movies released till 2016
source.ca36c206: 📌After inflation of gross income of movies that were released before has increased because of that the movie 'Snow White and Seven Dwarf' became Disney's most valuable movie in term of gross income till date even avengers endgame don't come close😮
source.7db199ec: Let's convert the variable release_date to datetime
source.a1bd9bc0:
📌We can see similar trends in MPAA rating early Disney movies were used to be G rated but recent ones are mostly PG and PG-13 rated
📌because of inflation in the gross income of movie early movie that was rated G grossed more than current PG or PG-13 rated movies
source.f16996c3:
📌The first movie produced by Disney was a musical which was classic 'Snow White and Seven dwarfs'
📌we can see the frequency of movies is increasing with year
📌Total Gross of movies is also increasing with year
📌Another interesting insight is the popularity of genre changed over time so we can further use the decade variable for further analysis
source.f8bfa501:
• movie_title: title of the movie
  • release_date: release date of the movie
  • genre: genre of the movie
  • mpaa_rating: Motion Picture Association film rating system rating of the movie
  • total_gross: total gross of the movie
  • inflation_adjusted_gross: refers to gross of the movie after inflation so old movies values more
source.7883da04: Using movie_title we can classify movies based on their franchise
source.844b54f7:
📌seems like in different decades Disney focused on making movies from different genres
📌from 1980-2010 they mostly focused on comedy movies even though adventure movies performed much better from 2010 onwards it's looked like they noticed and started to focus more on the adventure genre
